intro: Combretocarpus rotundatus, commonly known as the roundleaf combretum, is a tropical shrub native to regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
